subsection_content: Malaria is a disease caused by the Plasmodium parasite with symptoms of headache, fever, chills and death. People get sick after being bitten by Anopheles mosquitoes for 10-15 days. The disease can be transmitted through blood transfusion, mother to child, sharing needles contaminated with blood containing malaria parasites or mosquito bites. (first)
subsection_data:
sot ret.json. What is malaria?
Malaria is a disease caused by the Plasmodium parasite with symptoms of headache, fever, chills and death. People get sick after being bitten by Anopheles mosquitoes for 10-15 days. The disease can be transmitted through blood transfusion, mother to child, sharing needles contaminated with blood containing malaria parasites or mosquito bites. (first)
